descendants.content: @FantasticalEconomics Thanks for pointing this out! But: Even if something like that would come (I don’t think so at all) it would never be enforced with sufficient strength on the global scale (that would be a necessary condition to work).

account.note: #Biologist, #Biodiversity, #Ecology, #Agroecology, #Tech, #Gardening, #Chilis, #Mountainbiking

fields.name: English science blog

descendants.content:
@timaeus

I would say it would be challenging, for sure. But it could work.

My mentality is we need to change almost everything in our global system to prevent climate collapse. That a global tax couldn't work within our current system, isn't sufficient to say it won't work in future ones.

Our social systems will change and evolve over time, and we can't know what that will look like. I'm very much on favor of making progress where we can with a hope for better systems in the back of my mind.

account.note:
I'm an environmental economist who researches econ pedagogy to make learning economics marginally less dismal.

My pipe-dream is to write a fantasy novel/economics textbook, which is getting closer to reality every day.

#economics #TeachEcon #sustainability #DoughnutEconomics #degrowth

Profile pic is me smiling in front of a whiteboard with economics gibberish -- cause econ makes me happy.

Background is my dog, Freya, who is derpily sticking her tongue out while passed out.

fields.name: About me
fields.value: Making econ marginally less dismal one post at a time. I teach economics at the UC Denver and am an all around nerd. My goal is to combine my passion for all things fantasy/sci-fi and love of economics to lower the cost of learning econ.

fields.name: Fantastical Economics
fields.value: You can find my first-ever short story that covers the circular economy and sustainability in a sci-fi setting here: https://edgeryders.eu/t/circular-reasoning/19717

descendants.content: @FantasticalEconomics I absolutely agree with you and like how you phrase it, saying that if it doesn’t work now it might be working in the future. I just fear that the pressure required to facilitate such a system change can only come from some catastrophic events, like a collapse of the Atlantic circulation https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_meridional_overturning_circulation

descendants.content:
@timaeus

Unfortunately, I agree with you. I don't see us making meaningful changes until the costs are, catostrophically, slapping us in the face.

Still, I think there is much we can, and should, do to prepare ourselves for when that devastating opportunity arises. Discussing options (like this tax) and continuing to get the message out to folks about how bad it's likely to get are a start.

card.title: Tax The Rich
card.description: Nous voulons un  impôt européen sur les grandes fortunes  pour financer la transition climatique et sociale et aider les pays victimes des dérèglements climatiques.

descendants.content:
@FantasticalEconomics

“‘Only about 100 families around the world would be affected by the proposed 2% levy,’ she* added.”

*Ana Toni, national secretary for climate change in the government of President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva

ONE HUNDRED FAMILIES!?

‼️🤯🤬🔥‼️

Approximately 8 BILLION people are being held hostage by an infinitesimal number of humans’ greed. Newsflash: the ants outnumber the grasshoppers.

#Climate #climateChange

account.note: Author, gardener, #FaerieManager. Feat. CNN, Christian Science Monitor, BBC, Shriver Center. Happy For No Reason® Trainer. Work in progress. Website/books etc in ABOUT tab. Chicagoan. She/hers #Fedified

fields.name: Newsletter (#3MR)
fields.value: https://www.linkedin.com/build-relation/newsletter-follow?entityUrn=7036702800168325120

fields.name: Coaching sessions
fields.value: https://calendly.com/mckra1g/hfnr-resilience-reset?month=2022-11

descendants.content:
@mckra1g

Power is such an interesting concept. These 100 families have pretty much unlimited power, until they don't.

I'm not quite to the point of suggesting we ants rise up and overthrow the grasshoppers, but they do need to realize it's a credible threat for things to change, imo.

Regardless, we ants need to come together because united, we will be the ones with power. Which is why so much is spent on trying to divide us.
